humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the largest tumor size, which is 11.0 cm (gross measurement), and it is an invasive lobular carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, so in this case, the T stage is T3 (more than 5 cm). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive lobular carcinoma. The T stage is not affected by the number of lymph nodes involved or the presence of metastasis.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is based on the size of the tumor. In this report, the largest dimension of the invasive tumor is measured at 11.0 cm (gross measurement). According to the TNM staging system, a T3 stage is assigned when the tumor is larger than 5.0 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.
